structural_analysis.context_justification: The document explicitly names the Pañcamī Valli (5th Valli). In standard Katha Upanishad structure, this Valli belongs to Adhyaya 2. The first parsed unit is Mantra 1. Thus, the coordinate is 2.5.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, assumed commentator slug (srirangaramanuja), and zero-padded start ID (02-05-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Single Chunk Processing
proposed_strategy.description: The total character count is very low (~13.7k characters), allowing the entire text (Valli 5 and its commentary) to be processed efficiently as a single chunk, well below the safety limit.

execution_plan.description: Complete Pañcamī Valli (Mantra 1 through 15) and its commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: Mantra is the core numbered unit within the Valli, linking the primary text (Śruti) with its associated commentary (Prakāśikā).
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed in double pipes (।। X ।।) immediately following the bolded Mantra text.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra unit starts with the bolded Sanskrit text of the verse, followed by the coordinate marker.

end_pattern.description: The unit ends immediately before the start of the next Mantra (identified by its bold text) or the final Valli colophon.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Handle all text, including the initial Grantha title, Valli heading, and commentary heading, that precedes the first Mantra's coordinate (।। १ ।।) as 'Valli Introductory Material'.
